title: Tyson Posts Higher Quarterly Profit on Price Increases, Strong Demand
sub_head: Meatpacker has raised prices as it faces staffing issues and higher costs
body:
Profit rose more than expected at Tyson Foods Inc. in the three months through December, with strong demand and higher pricing offsetting challenges the meatpacker has faced from labor shortages and rising costs.
Shares gained more than 5% in premarket trading Monday as Tyson’s profit beat Wall Street’s forecasts and the company reiterated its outlook for sales growth in fiscal 2022. Tyson said it is expecting revenue to come in near the top of a previously issued guidance range projecting $49 billion to $51 billion in sales this fiscal year.
